qas.question: How many natural isotopes does hydrogen have>
What are the names of these isotopes?

context: Hydrogen has three naturally occurring isotopes, <a1_0>denoted 1H, 2H and <a0_0>3H<a1_0/><a0_0/>. Other, highly unstable nuclei (<a2_0>4H to 7H<a2_0/>) have been synthesized in the laboratory but not observed in nature.
